definitions.definition: A lighter - than - air aircraft that can be propelled forward through the air as well as steered .
examples: Airships are posited to be cheaper to operate over time than fixed-wing aircraft, but as there are no large fleets, this is hard to prove in practice.

definitions.definition: A police air unit, a police helicopter.

examples: On weekends, I liked to spend my time at the airport watching the various airships take off and land.

definitions.definition: A high ranking official of the RAF , viewed as arrogant and distant.
definitions.label_groups: British , derogatory , chiefly in the plural

main_definition: ( aviation ) A lighter - than - air aircraft that can be propelled forward through the air as well as steered .
secondary_definitions: ( US , law enforcement , aviation ) A police air unit, a police helicopter.
( British , derogatory , chiefly in the plural ) A high ranking official of the RAF , viewed as arrogant and distant.
